autumn.lang

Interface Record

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Record>, java.lang.Iterable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    RecordAnalyzer.Citizen, RecordAnalyzer.Person
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRecord

    public interface Record
extends java.lang.Iterable, java.lang.Comparable<Record>
    An instance of this interface is a user-defined key-value mapping data-structure.

    This interface only defines the minimum required functionality. Convenience functions are provided by class autumn.util.Records and class autumn.util.F.

    Subtypes of this interface should provide covariant overrides of the set(String, Object) method. For example, a type name T should provide a set(String, Object) : T method.

        This method determines whether this object was created from a struct-definition.

        This method determines whether this object was created from a tuple-definition.
        Returns:
        true, if this object is an instance of a tuple.

      • keys

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> keys()
        This method retrieves a list that contains the names of the elements in this record.

        This is a constant-time operation.

        Returns:
        the aforedescribed immutable list.

      • types

        java.util.List<java.lang.Class> types()
        This method creates a new list containing the type of each element in this record.

        This is a constant-time operation.

        Returns:
        the aforedescribed immutable list.

      • values

        java.util.List<java.lang.Object> values()
        This method creates a new list containing the value of each element in this record.

        This is a linear-time operation.

        The new collection is not backed by this object.

        Returns:
        the aforedescribed immutable list.

      • set

        Record set(int index,
         java.lang.Object value)
        This method assigns a new value to a specific element.

        Auto-unboxing will be performed, if necessary. However, the unboxed value will not be automatically widened.

        Parameters:
        index - is the index of the element to assign the value to.
        value - is the new value.
        Returns:
        this object, if this record is mutable; otherwise, return a modified copy thereof.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out-of-bounds.
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the object is not of an acceptable type.

        java.lang.Object get(int index)
        This method retrieves the value of a specific element.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the value of the element.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out-of-bounds.

      • size

        int size()
        This method counts the elements in this record.

        This is a constant-time operation.

        Returns:
        key().size()

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        This method determines whether this record is empty.

        This is a constant-time operation.

        Returns:
        true, iff the size() of this tuple is zero.

      • iterator

        java.util.Iterator iterator()
        This method creates an iterator over the values in this record.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable
        Returns:
        values().iterator().

      • compareTo

        int compareTo(Record other)
        This method compares this record to another given record.

        Records are compared based on the natural ordering of their values(). If the other object is null, then this object is object is greater. If the other object is non-null, then the two records must have exactly the same keys().

        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Record>
        Parameters:
        other - is the other record itself.
        Returns:
        an integer indicating the relationship of this record to the other record.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the comparison operation could not be completed.

      • equals

        boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        This method determines whether this record equals another object.

        Equality Rules:

        1. If other is null, then return false.
        2. If this is the same object as other, then return true.
        3. If other is not a Record, return false.
        4. If this.keys() is not equal to other.keys(), then return false.
        5. If this.values() is not equal to other.values(), then return false.
        6. Return true.

        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        other - is a value that may be equal to this object.
        Returns:
        true, iff this record equals the given value.

      • hashCode

        int hashCode()
        This method computes a hash-code for this record.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        keys().hashCode() xor values().hashCode()

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        This method creates a string representation of this object.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        value().toString().
